{"step_by_step_thinking": "The relevant document that provides information about the nerves supplying the ear lobule is Document [6]. According to this document, the sensory innervation to the external ear, including the ear lobule, is supplied by both cranial and spinal nerves. The greater auricular nerve (C2, C3) and the lesser occipital nerve (C2, C3) are the spinal nerve components involved in the sensory innervation of the ear lobule. The facial nerve (CN VII) and the auriculotemporal nerve (CN V3) are the cranial nerve components involved in the sensory innervation of the ear lobule. Therefore, the correct answer is A.
